name: Trisquel GNU/Linux 11.0
install_guide_markdown:
# Trisquel GNU/Linux 11.0 Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 1 GB RAM minimum (2 GB recommended)
- 20 GB free disk space
- USB drive (4 GB+) for bootable media
- Hardware that works with free software drivers only

## Important Note
Trisquel is 100% free software and doesn't include proprietary drivers or firmware. Verify hardware compatibility before installation.

## Step 1: Download and Verify ISO
Download from official Trisquel mirrors.

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use tools like Rufus (Windows), Etcher (cross-platform), or dd (Linux).

## Step 3: Boot from USB
Restart computer and access boot menu.

## Step 4: Install Trisquel
Follow Ubiquity graphical installer (similar to Ubuntu).

## Step 5: Post-Installation
All software is free (as in freedom). Use Trisquel's repositories for additional applications.

install_steps.title: Check Hardware Compatibility
install_steps.detail_md:
Before installation, verify your hardware works with free software drivers.

Trisquel **does not** include:
- Proprietary firmware
- Binary blobs
- Non-free drivers

Check the h-node.org database for compatible hardware.

install_steps.title: Download Trisquel ISO
install_steps.detail_md:
Download Trisquel 11.0 from the official website.

**Standard Edition (MATE)**: 2.2 GB  
**Mini Edition (LXDE)**: 1.2 GB  

Trisquel is FSF-endorsed and 100% free software.

install_steps.title: Verify ISO Checksum
install_steps.detail_md: Verify the downloaded ISO using SHA256 checksum to ensure file integrity and authenticity.

commands.explanation: Linux command to verify SHA256 checksum

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB Drive
install_steps.detail_md:
Use a USB drive (4 GB or larger) to create bootable installation media.

**WARNING**: This will erase all data on the USB drive.

install_steps.title: Boot from USB Drive
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB drive and restart your computer. Access boot menu to select USB drive.

install_steps.title: Install Trisquel
install_steps.detail_md:
Click "Install Trisquel" icon on the live desktop.

Follow Ubiquity installer:
- Select language
- Configure keyboard layout
- Set up disk partitions
- Create user account
- Install system

install_steps.title: Enjoy Free Software
install_steps.detail_md:
Trisquel repositories contain only free software as defined by the GNU Project.

All applications respect your freedom:
- No proprietary software
- No binary blobs
- No DRM or restrictions

Install additional software from Trisquel's repositories.

description: Trisquel is a fully free GNU/Linux distribution endorsed by the Free Software Foundation. It contains only free software and libre Linux kernel without binary blobs.
long_description: Trisquel GNU/Linux is a fully free operating system for home users, small enterprises, and educational institutions. It's based on Ubuntu but with all proprietary software, firmware, and blobs removed, replaced with the Linux-libre kernel. Trisquel is officially endorsed by the Free Software Foundation and meets their strict guidelines for free distributions. The project's goal is to provide a completely free operating system that respects user freedom and privacy. Trisquel includes only software that is free as in freedom - you can run, study, share, and modify all included software. The default edition features the MATE desktop environment, while Trisquel Mini offers a lightweight LXDE option. It's ideal for users who prioritize software freedom and want to avoid proprietary software entirely.
